intro: Camaridium standleyi, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Camaridium standleyi is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
